hero_badge: Major platforms are starting to require ID verification
hero_sub: mqvi is an open-source communication platform with end-to-end encryption, no identity verification, and full self-hosting support.
problem_desc: Popular communication platforms are increasingly demanding government-issued IDs. After multiple data breaches, would you trust them with your passport or national ID?
feat_desc: Every feature designed with privacy at its core. Zero data collection, full transparency.
f1_desc: Messages, files, and voice calls are only readable by sender and recipient. Not even the server can access them.
f2_desc: Low-latency, high-quality voice and video powered by LiveKit. Community voice channels and private calls.
f3_desc: Your server, your rules. One-command setup, full control. Your data never leaves your hands.
f4_desc: No email, phone number, or government ID needed. Pick a username and start chatting.
f5_desc: Share your screen in voice channels for presentations, pair coding, or watching content together.
f6_desc: Granular role system with custom permissions. Control who can do what, down to the channel level.
f7_desc: Add friends, send direct messages through peer-to-peer connections. No server in between — truly private.
f8_desc: Full source code is public. Don't trust — verify. Audit our code, contribute, or fork it.
f9_desc: Go backend, minimal dependencies. No Electron bloat. Use from browser or native client.
comp_desc: Side by side with mainstream alternatives.
road_desc: mqvi is under active development. Here's where we are and where we're headed.
sh_desc: Set up your own LiveKit voice server and connect it to mqvi. Follow these steps — no coding experience needed.
guide_s1_desc: You need a server (a computer that's always online). You can rent one from these providers for $3–5/month. Pick any provider, create the cheapest plan, and choose Ubuntu or Debian as the operating system.
guide_s2_desc: Connect to your server via SSH (your provider will show you how). Then run this single command to install Docker — it handles everything automatically.
guide_s3_desc: LiveKit needs specific ports to be open for voice/video to work. Think of ports like doors — if they're closed, voice traffic can't get through.
guide_s3_tip: If your provider has a web-based firewall (like Hetzner's), you must also open these ports there. The terminal commands alone are not enough — check your provider's dashboard too.
guide_s4_desc: This command downloads and starts the LiveKit voice server. It will run in the background and restart automatically if your server reboots.
guide_s5_desc: Before running the Docker command above, create a file called livekit.yaml in your current directory. This file tells LiveKit which ports to use and sets your API credentials.
guide_s5_tip: Change 'myapikey' and 'mysecretkey123456' to your own values. The API key is like a username, the secret is like a password. Make the secret long and random — never share it publicly.
guide_s6_desc: Go to mqvi, create a new server, and select "Self-Hosted". Enter these 3 values from your config file:
guide_s6_tip: That's it! mqvi will use your LiveKit server for all voice and video in your server. Your conversations never touch our infrastructure.
guide_trouble_a1: Ports are probably closed. Run 'sudo ufw status' and check that 7880, 7881, 7882, and 50000-60000 are listed. Also check your cloud provider's web firewall.
guide_trouble_q2: I can connect but hear no audio
guide_trouble_a2: UDP ports 50000-60000 might be blocked. These carry the actual voice data. Make sure your provider allows UDP traffic on these ports.
guide_trouble_a3: LiveKit container might not be running. Run 'docker ps' to check. If it's not listed, run 'docker logs livekit' to see what went wrong.
guide_trouble_q4: Works on LAN but not from outside
guide_trouble_a4: Make sure 'use_external_ip: true' is set in your livekit.yaml. Without this, LiveKit sends local IPs that external users can't reach.
cta_desc: mqvi is currently in early access. Be among the first to try it and shape its future.
